page.title: 14Bird Life; Papa Westray
page.content: Papay is ideally situated as a resting place for the Spring and Autumn migration to and from North Europe. Rarities such as Mandarin Ducks, Bee-Eaters, Scops Owl and Ospreys have been sighted. Large numbers of Kittiwakes,and Fulmars breed on the Reserve at the north of the island. This reserve also has the largest colony of Arctic Terns in Europe where between 5 and 6 thousand pairs nest each year. In the winter months there are large numbers of Golden Plover, Curlew,Field Fare and Redwing. During the Spring and Autumn many small birds such as Blackcap, Gold Finches and Warblers pass through on their migration.
